metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Sept 24, 1966
My job is enjoyable to me
My job is working with Grass. Roots and underprivileged people,
who are being denied many of the better things in life. I like this job because 
it is a Challenge to me. In 1948, I called a group of John's Island people together
to organize what is called the progressive club. We set our own goals and agreed to work
together to attain them. First, we felt that those of our group who were living on 
plantations or other peoples lands, should be encourage and helped to buy lands [sic] of 
their own and build their homes so that they and their children might have freedom to attend schools. 
We set up an Adult Citizenship School to help the adults in reading and writing. So they would be able to register 
and vote at the proper time. 
In 1950 we asked the school board to build us one Consolidated School with four years high, 
plus the[y] needed buses that our children may ride to school just as the white children do.
This was done and all of the above metnion[sic] goals for the John's Island people were reached
and as a result the groups is[sic] now smiling. This make me happy also.
